activities:
(1)The Walt Disney Company processes or will process personal data received through telephone communications concerning compliance with one or more aspects of its Standards of Business Conduct.
(2)The Integrated Workplace Management System (“IWMS”) will process information for management of real estate assets.
(3)The Customer Data Environment (“CDE”) processes consumer data, including personally identifiable data collected in the European Union, for marketing purposes.
(4)The Workscape Compensation Management System will process employee data for the purpose of compensation planning and management.
(5)The travel advisory system (“Travel Advisor”) processes employee travel data for the purpose of contacting employee travelers regarding travel alerts or emergency situations.
(6)An internal database (“Send Word Now”) processes employee contact information in order to issue emergency notifications.
(7)An emergency notification system (“WebEOC”) processes employee contact information to provide communication between company Emergency Operations Centers during emergency or disaster situations.
(8) A system for processing HR data ("Global Staffing") for recruiting purposes and for applicant information management. 
(9) A database containing labor resource information ("HR" Analytics"), used for the purpose of reporting and monitoring workforce performance.
(10) A File transfer system (GlobalScape"), used for the purpose of transferring email files related to labor resources information.
(11) A web-based application ("Securimate") processing information about third-party vendors and their employees for the purpose of ensuring compliance with various anti-corruption laws.
(12) A database of Disney patent information ("Lecorpio") used for the purpose of managing and statusing Disney patents.
(13) An emergency notification system ("Everbridge") that stores individual contact information for various Disney Business Units.
(14) An incident tracking system ("PPM") that is used to manage security investigations.
(15) A web-based program publishing HR data in an organization chart format (“OrgPublisher WebAdmin”) that is accessed by HR leaders through the internet.
(16) An access control system (“Lenel”) that stores individual contact information for various Disney Business Units in order to track visitors to Disney facilities.
(17) An application information management system (“Chequed”) processing personal information for the purpose of verifying job applicant references.
(18) An enterprise application processing HR data (“Continuity Logic”) for the purpose of assessing risk, compliance and continuity for business continuity management.
(19) A central repository (“Global Mobility”) storing Human Resource data for the purpose of managing the relocation and re-assignment process.
